chapter.title: Exercise: Process with an exclusive gateway

section.title: Goal
section.para: The goal of this exercise is to extend the existing process by adding a dynamic validation of the leave request. This will be achieved with the use of an exclusive gateway which will lead to two execution paths: one for the accepted request and one for the rejected request.

section.title: Instructions
section.para: Duplicate the process diagram from the previous exercise to create a 3.0 version.
Modify the diagram to add the following elements after the "Validate request" task:

listitem.para: a service task named "Notify request accepted"
a terminate end event named "End - Request rejected"
a service task named "Notify request rejected"
a terminate end event named "End - Request accepted"

section.para: Configure the transitions going out the exclusive gateway so that they control dynamically the process flow based on process data.

para.emphasis: Duplicate the process diagram from the previous exercise to create a 3.0 version.

listitem.para: Select the event from the diagram and hit "delete" on your keyboard.

para.emphasis: Add an exclusive gateway named "Is accepted?" next to the human task "Validate request".

listitem.para: Select the "Validate request" task, perform a drag and drop from the gateway contextual icon.
Once you have created the gateway, use the context "tool" icon (1) to change its type to "Exclusive" (2).

para.emphasis: Create a service task named "Notify request accepted" after the gateway.
Add a terminate end event named "End - Request accepted" next to the newly added service task.
Create a service task named "Notify request rejected" after the gateway.
Add a terminate end event named "End - Request rejected" next to the newly added service task.
Name the two transitions going out of the gateway

listitem.para: The transition leading to the "Notify request accepted" task should be named "Yes" and the other "No".

para.emphasis: Configure condition on the "Yes" transition to use the "isApproved" data.

listitem.para: Select the transition and select the "isApproved" data from the condition dropdown.

para.emphasis: Set the "No" transition as the default flow.

listitem.para: Select the transition and check the "Default flow" property.
Once the transition conditions are properly set, you can validate the process diagram. To do so, click on "Diagram / Validate" from the Studio's top menu.

Execute twice the process to test the different paths.

listitem.para: Warning: do not hit twice the "Run" button, this would redeploy the process and clear the history. In order to create the second process instance, you will need to navigate in the Bonita Portal.
Open the Portal with the dedicated button in the Studio's top toolbar or from the top right link in the web user interface:
Then, navigate to the "Processes" menu and select the "Leave request" process definition with version 3.0 and click on "Start".

para.emphasis: Check that the process is correctly executed in the Portal administration interface.

listitem.para: In the Portal, switch to the "Administrator" profile with the top right dropdown.
Navigate to the "Process management / Cases" menu (1) then, switch to the "Archived cases" tab (2) and click on the eye icon (3) to view the case details.
Check the "Done tasks" section to validate the process execution:
